snippet: In his first appearance at the Capitol since his terms as California Governor, a nostalgic Ronald Reagan today stepped lightly over the state's budget deficit and instead celebrated the California that "encourages the dreamer in us all."   The 80-...
lead_paragraph: In his first appearance at the Capitol since his terms as California Governor, a nostalgic Ronald Reagan today stepped lightly over the state's budget deficit and instead celebrated the California that "encourages the dreamer in us all." The 80-year-old former President addressed a rare joint session of the state Legislature, at the invitation of the Democratic leadership of the Assembly, and used the occasion to tell self-deprecating jokes, campaign for the gun-control bill that is before Congress and commiserate without offering advice about the state's $12.6 billion budget deficit.

headline.main: Reagan Guest Stars Before the California Assembly
